text:
142-144 Meeker Avenue (tracks thereon) south side, at and adjoining Monitor Street, also shown is the east side of Monitor Street, south from Meeker Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

August 13, 1938.

Meeker Avenue, south side, west of Monitor Street, showing at the corner the Kroder Riebl Co. plant, manufacturers of brass goods.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: August 13, 1938
View 2: September 1, 1939

Note: The building shown in view 1 was torn down later to make way for the approach to the Kosciuszko Bridge over Newtown Creek.

View 2 shows the S.E. corner of Meeker and Monitor, after some of the buildings were razed.

Meeker Avenue, south side, west of Monitor Street, showing at the corner the Kroder Riebl Co. plant, manufacturers of brass goods.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: August 13, 1938
View 2: September 1, 1939

Note: The building shown in view 1 was torn down later to make way for the approach to the Kosciuszko Bridge over Newtown Creek.

View 2 shows the S.E. corner of Meeker and Monitor, after some of the buildings were razed.
